intro: Homoglossum flexicaule, commonly known as the flexible homoglossum, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
